dataSourceInfo.title: Where do the data come from?
dataSourceInfo.subTitle: Data Source

GoogleEnvironmentalInsightsExplorer.title: Google Environmental Insights Explorer
GoogleEnvironmentalInsightsExplorer.description: The Google Environmental Insights Explorer (EIE) is based on the idea that data and technology can help accelerate the world’s transition to a low-carbon future. The EIE aims to simplify the process of establishing an emissions baseline and identifying tangible reduction opportunities, providing the foundation for effective action. The EIE uses exclusive Google data sources and modeling capabilities to generate activity, emissions, and reduction opportunity estimates. By providing environmental information on a robust, free platform, we aim to serve decision-makers and researchers working on these issues and solutions for cities worldwide.

TransportIssuance.title: Transport Emissions
TransportIssuance.description: Transportation vehicles generate greenhouse gas emissions both directly from fossil fuel combustion and indirectly from electricity used by electric vehicles (EVs). The amount of GHG emitted by the transportation sector in a city depends on factors such as: modes of transport, types of fuels used, vehicle age and efficiency, total number of trips, and annual kilometers traveled.

BuildingIssuance.title: Building Emissions
BuildingIssuance.description: Buildings generate greenhouse gas emissions directly from the combustion of fossil fuels (e.g., heating) and indirectly from the electricity used by residents and equipment. The amount of GHG emitted directly or indirectly by buildings depends on various factors such as: the number of buildings, building types, etc.

EmissionsPerPassenger.title: Emissions per Passenger (kgCO2e)
EmissionsPerPassenger.infoToolTip: Emissions per passenger refers to the amount of CO2 emissions produced per passenger for each mode of transport. This metric helps to understand the environmental impact of transporting a single passenger using different modes of transport.

content.2: has the lowest impact per kWh with

buildings.title: Building Emissions
buildings.description: Information about CO2 emissions from buildings helps the organization monitor, analyze, and progress towards sustainability goals, focusing on reducing greenhouse gases.

EnergyFractions.title: Energy Composition and Emissions Impact in the Municipality
EnergyFractions.description: Analysis of the composition of energy sources used in the municipality and evaluation of the CO2 emissions impact generated by different types of energy.

CompositionOfEnergySourcesBySector.title: Composition of Energy Sources by Sector

ImpactOfEnergySourcesOnEmissions.title: Impact of Energy Sources on Emissions

EnergyIntensities.title: Emission Intensity by Energy Source
EnergyIntensities.description: Compares the amount of CO2 emitted per kilowatt-hour among different energy sources, highlighting the environmental impact of each.

CompositionOfEnergySourcesBySector.title: Composition of Energy Sources by Sector

ImpactOfEnergySourcesOnEmissions.title: Impact of Energy Sources on Emissions

targetAdherence.content: of the emissions reduction target for

goalTrackerTable.title: Transportation Emissions Report for the Last Year

transports.title: Transport emissions
transports.description: Information on CO2 emissions in transportation helps organizations monitor, analyze, and progress toward sustainability goals, focusing on reducing greenhouse gases.

withinTheBorder.title: Within the border
withinTheBorder.infoTooltip: Relates to emissions collected by trips that started and ended in the city itself.

outOfTheBorder.title: Outside the border
outOfTheBorder.infoTooltip: Relates to emissions collected by trips that at some point in the trip passed through the city. That is, that vehicle at some point emitted carbon in the city, but his trip did not end in the city itself

CO2InboundAndOutbound.title: Comparison of emissions within and outside geographic boundaries
CO2InboundAndOutbound.description: Compares the average CO2 emissions per kilometer between different types of transport, differentiating emissions within and outside geographic boundaries.

Co2EmissionPerTransport.title: Comparison of emissions by type of transport
Co2EmissionPerTransport.description: Compares CO2 emissions divided by specific types of transport, providing insight into the efficiency of each mode over the years.

Co2EmissionPerKilometer.title: Comparison of emissions per kilometer and type of transport
Co2EmissionPerKilometer.description: Compares CO2 emissions per kilometer between different types of transport, highlighting the variations between modes.
